personal_loan_credit_rules.description: Ruleset for evaluating personal loan credit applications for individuals.

rules.name: Minimum Age Requirement
rules.description: Applicant must be at least 18 years old to be legally eligible for a loan.

rules.name: Minimum Credit Score
rules.description: Applicant's credit score must meet the minimum threshold for loan consideration.

rules.name: Minimum Annual Income
rules.description: Applicant's verified annual gross income must meet the minimum required for a personal loan.

rules.name: Maximum Debt-to-Income Ratio (DTI)
rules.description: Applicant's total monthly debt payments (excluding mortgage) relative to gross monthly income must not exceed a specified percentage.

rules.name: Current Employment Status
rules.description: Applicant must be currently employed or have a verifiable, stable source of income.

rules.name: Minimum Employment Duration
rules.description: Applicant must have been employed in their current role or field for a minimum duration.

rules.name: Residency Status
rules.description: Applicant must be a US Citizen or Permanent Resident.

rules.name: No Recent Bankruptcy Filing
rules.description: Applicant must not have filed for bankruptcy within the last 7 years.

rules.name: Loan Amount within Income Ratio
rules.description: Requested loan amount should not exceed a certain multiple of the applicant's annual income.

rules.name: Verifiable Bank Account
rules.description: Applicant must possess at least one verifiable, active bank account for fund disbursement and repayment.
